column4: Hello, anyone good with Grub? I'm trying to dual boot, and when I select windows partition I get "Error 13: Invalid or unsupported executable format"
do you have more than one drive installed in your machine?
No, just one 500gb one, split into 3, Linux Swap, Ubuntu, and Windows.
you might need to reinstall grub.. have you tried that already?
I just did, actually, following the help documentation. I then rebooted and did not find a windows option, so I made one as per the documentation
was windows the first system installed before ubuntu?
Ubuntu was on there first, I just installed windows this morning, Ubuntu's been around for about 2 months.
typically windows likes to be first but there might be hope.. the tutorial you used, was it from the bot in this channel?
can you pastbin what's in /boot/grub/menu.list ?
Yes. :)

ok.. I think I see the problem.. the "root" line in the menu.lst shows windows as (hd0,0).. if it was the second OS installed and the partition used was more toward the end of the drive then the 0,0 reference is incorrect.
Oh. Ok. how would I find out which is correct?
as you count the partitions, the first is Ubuntu (maybe), then /swap, then windows.. so the correct reference might be (hd0,2) ... that references the 3rd partition
0=1st partition
Hm. Ok. I think it would be 0,1, then.
0,1 would be the first drive second partition
Thank you, I will try that now
why did you install on a seperate partition?  for gaming? if not for gaming vbox might be a solution
I installed it for UT3 and Photoshop/Lightroom/Illustrator
ah.. oh.. usually ut has a native installer for linux..
UT3 has not got one yet and I've had the box over a year, so I gave up on waiting
Thank you for your help. :) If I do not return it worked! :D
no problem.. if it doesn't work play with the second number
